intro: Canthium rheedei, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its spiny, woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Canthium rheedei is also known for its medicinal properties, used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
